docs.lead_paragraph: Thirty years ago, poor Brazilian women were paid for their breast milk, leaving their children at risk of malnourishment. Equipment at the few milk collection centers was so costly it limited the country's ability to expand the program's reach.

headline.main: Brazil's Maternal Milk Banks Model for Globe
headline.print_headline: Brazil's Maternal Milk Banks Model for Globe

docs.snippet: Thirty years ago, poor Brazilian women were paid for their breast milk, leaving their children at risk of malnourishment. Equipment at the few milk collection centers was so costly it limited the country's ability to expand the program's reach.

docs.lead_paragraph: Agriculture tourism lures travelers each fall with farms offering petting zoos, dressed-up scarecrows, pick-your-own pumpkins and pony rides. But Stone Barns, in New York's Hudson Valley, offers a different type of agritourism.

headline.main: Stone Barns in NY: Farm Education, Not Agritourism
headline.print_headline: Stone Barns in NY: Farm Education, Not Agritourism

docs.snippet: Agriculture tourism lures travelers each fall with farms offering petting zoos, dressed-up scarecrows, pick-your-own pumpkins and pony rides. But Stone Barns, in New York's Hudson Valley, offers a different type of agritourism.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. drugmaker Hospira’s HSP.N talks to buy the medical nutrition unit of Danone DANO.PA and use the deal to move its tax domicile abroad have stalled, according to people familiar with the matter, as attempts by U.S. companies to relocate abroad and cut their tax bills draw growing criticism back home.

headline.main: Exclusive: Hospira Talks With Danone on $5 Billion Tax Inversion Deal Stall
headline.print_headline: Exclusive: Hospira Talks With Danone on $5 Billion Tax Inversion Deal Stall

docs.lead_paragraph: The percentage of Americans regarded as "food insecure" - lacking access to enough food for a healthy life - has edged down in the past few years but still represents over 17 million households, the U.S. Agriculture Department said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Slightly Fewer U.S. Households Lacking Enough Food: USDA
headline.print_headline: Slightly Fewer U.S. Households Lacking Enough Food: USDA

docs.snippet: The percentage of Americans regarded as "food insecure" - lacking access to enough food for a healthy life - has edged down in the past few years but still represents over 17 million households, the U.S. Agriculture Department said on Wednesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Danone said on Tuesday that Chairman and Chief Executive Franck Riboud would split his role after 18 years at the helm of the world's largest yoghurt maker, which is grappling with a series of setbacks in Asia and in Europe.

headline.main: Danone Names New CEO as Riboud Prepares for Succession
headline.print_headline: Danone Names New CEO as Riboud Prepares for Succession

docs.snippet: Danone said on Tuesday that Chairman and Chief Executive Franck Riboud would split his role after 18 years at the helm of the world's largest yoghurt maker, which is grappling with a series of setbacks in Asia and in Europe.

docs.lead_paragraph: The world's worst Ebola epidemic has endangered harvests and sent food prices soaring in West Africa, the U.N. Food and Agriculture Organisation (FAO) said on Tuesday, warning the problem would intensify in coming months.

headline.main: Ebola Threatens Food Security in West Africa-FAO
headline.print_headline: Ebola Threatens Food Security in West Africa-FAO

docs.snippet: The world's worst Ebola epidemic has endangered harvests and sent food prices soaring in West Africa, the U.N. Food and Agriculture Organisation (FAO) said on Tuesday, warning the problem would intensify in coming months.

docs.lead_paragraph: Research published in the journal Pediatrics indicates that early preferences for fruits and vegetables or, conversely, sugary drinks last into age 6.

headline.main: Childhood Diet Habits Set in Infancy, Studies Suggest
headline.print_headline: Childhood Diet Habits Set in Infancy, Studies Suggest

docs.abstract: Research published in journal Pediatrics indicates that early preferences for fruits and vegetables or, conversely, sugary drinks last into age 6.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: In a finding that upends long-held notions about a healthy diet, a major study shows that avoiding carbohydrates and eating more fat contributes to weight loss and fewer cardiovascular risks.

headline.main: A Call for a Low-Carb Diet That Embraces Fat
headline.print_headline: A Call for a Low-Carb Diet

docs.abstract: National Institutes of Health study published in the Annals of Internal Medicine finds that people who avoid carbohydrates and eat more fat have fewer cardiovascular risks than people who follow a low-fat diet and achieve better weight loss; landmark research produces more complex picture than previous dietary studies, lending credence to adherents of the Atkins diet and other low-carb methods.
docs.snippet: In a finding that upends long-held notions about a healthy diet, a major study shows that avoiding carbohydrates and eating more fat contributes to weight loss and fewer cardiovascular risks.

docs.abstract: African-Americans born at low birth weight are at an increased risk for Type 2 diabetes later in life, a new study has found.
docs.snippet: African-Americans born at low birth weight are at an increased risk for Type 2 diabetes later in life, a new study has found.

docs.lead_paragraph: Americans' eating habits have improved — except among the poor, evidence of a widening wealth gap when it comes to diet. Yet even among wealthier adults, food choices remain far from ideal, a 12-year study found.

headline.main: US Eating Habits Improve a Bit _ Except Among Poor
headline.print_headline: US Eating Habits Improve a Bit _ Except Among Poor

docs.snippet: Americans' eating habits have improved — except among the poor, evidence of a widening wealth gap when it comes to diet. Yet even among wealthier adults, food choices remain far from ideal, a 12-year study found.
